description:
This data holding consists mostly of standard ocean station data
      (along with some current measurements) as well as some surface
      temperature data.
      
      FILE: Deep-sea oceanographic data; Tropical Indian (20S-25N,
      40E-120E)
      This data holding consists of about 50,000 stations (bathometer and STD) of
      salinity, temperature (including sea surface), and oxygen. In
      addition, currents are available from some stations. These
      observations go back to 1957. Russian data prevail; data from
      international expeditions (IIOE) are also  available. Data
      access is restricted.
      
      FILE:   Deep-sea oceanographic data; East Tropical Pacific
      (20S-20N, 180W-90W)
      This data holding consists of about 20,000 stations (bathometer and
      STD) of salinity, temperature (including sea surface), and
      oxygen. In addition, currents are available from some
      stations. These observations go back to 1964. Russian data
      prevail; a good deal of US data from published sources  (Passat
      Experiment and Shuttle) is also available. Data access is
      restricted.
      
      FILE: Deep-sea oceanographic data; Sea of Japan, Bering Sea, Sea of
      Okhotsk
      Physical and chemical data is available from about 80,000 stations
      (the Sea of Japan), about 60,000 stations (the Sea of Okhotsk), and
      about 37,500 stations (the Bering Sea). Temperature and Salinity,
      as well as alkalinity. Oxygen, pH, PO4, Si, and NO2 (hydrochemical
      elements have not been measured at every station).  Data taken with
      bathometer and STD. Russian data prevail; US and Japanese data
      taken from published sources are  also
      available. Data access is restricted.
      
      FILE: Deep-sea oceanographic data; Northwest Pacific (18N-44N,
      127E-156E)
      Over 42,000 oceanographic stations of temperature and salinity,
      dating back to 1930. Data taken with bathometer and STD. Russian
      data prevail; a great deal of Japanese data for the SIK and KER
      programmes (taken from published sources) is also available. Data
      access is restricted.
      
      FILE:   Mean-monthly sea-surface temperature; North of 20N in the
      Pacific
      Finally, this data set consists of mean-monthly sea-surface
      temperature and its anomalies in the North Pacific over two and a
      half degree squares (7,500) values, from 1966 to 1986. Weather data
      are used to compile  this data set.  Data access is restricted.
title: Ocean Station Surface and Subsurface Data from the Pacific and Indian Oceans, the Bering Sea, and the Seas of Japan and Okhotsk
